title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for implicit differentiation

1 point is earned for verification

2x+2+4 y 3 dy dx +4 dy dx =0 (4 y 3 +4) dy dx =−2x−2 dy dx = −2(x+1) 4( y 3 +1) = −(x+1) 2( y 3 +1) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@72A9@
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for implicit differentiation

1 point is earned for verification

2x+2+4 y 3 dy dx +4 dy dx =0 (4 y 3 +4) dy dx =−2x−2 dy dx = −2(x+1) 4( y 3 +1) = −(x+1) 2( y 3 +1) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@72A9@

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for implicit differentiation

1 point is earned for verification

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for implicit differentiation

1 point is earned for verification

2x+2+4 y 3 dy dx +4 dy dx =0 (4 y 3 +4) dy dx =−2x−2 dy dx = −2(x+1) 4( y 3 +1) = −(x+1) 2( y 3 +1) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@72A9@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the slope

1 point is earned for the tangent line equation

dy dx | (−2,1)  = −(−2+1) 2(1+1) = 1 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D6F@

Tangent line: y=1+ 1 4 (x+2)

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for y = -1

1 point is earned if substitutes y = -1 into the equation of the curve

1 point is earned for the answer

Vertical tangent lines occur at points on the curve where y 3 +1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3975@ = 0 (or y = -1) and x ≠ −1.

On the curve, y = -1 implies that x 2 +2x+1−4=5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F8C@ , so x = -4 or x = 2.

Vertical tangent lines occur at the points (-4, -1) and (2, -1).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned if works with x = -1 or y = 0

1 point is earned for answer with reason

Horizontal tangents occur at points on the curve where x = -1 and y ≠ -1.

The curve crosses the x-axis where y = 0.

(−1) 2 +2(−1)+ 0 4 +4⋅0≠5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48A1@

No, the curve cannot have a horizontal tangent where it crosses the x-axis.
